name: Never use incompatible statements with the CICS environment
description:
This rule searches for Cobol programs running under the CICS environment containing statements that are not permitted. These statements are the following:
- ACCEPT
- ENTRY
- DISPLAY
- FD and SD
- SELECT <file> ASSIGN TO
- OPEN, CLOSE, READ, WRITE, REWRITE, DELETE
- MERGE, SORT
- START
- STOP

The following exception is taken into account: some batch programs can contain EXEC CICS commands in order to run CICS utilities (DFH*). If these types of programs do not execute other commands, then they will not be considered as violating the rule.
output:
This report lists all CICS programs containing incompatible statements. 
It provides the following information:
- Cobol Program Full Name
- Number of violations

It also provides bookmarks for violation patterns found in source code:
- Incompatible Cobol statement
rationale: The CICS environment forbids some Cobol statements concerning I/O operations and program termination. The use of these statements can cause problems in production and can crash applications.
reference: IBM Enterprise Cobol for z/OS - Programming Guide
remediation: These statements must be removed from programs running under the CICS environment. Files can be accessed by using specific macros provided with CICS.
total: Number of Cobol Programs running under the CICS
